snippet: With a supermajority in the California Legislature, Democrats are both 100 percent in charge and apt to be held 100 percent accountable for any failures in the state government.
abstract: Democrats in California's Legislature are confronting struggles and complications that come with holding a supermajority, after gaining control of two-thirds of both the Senate and the Assembly; expanded authority is unleashing years of pent-up Democratic desires that had been largely checked by the Republican minority, and some Democrats are worried that result will be an overreach that could make the party's reign brief.
lead_paragraph: With a supermajority in the California Legislature, Democrats are both 100 percent in charge and apt to be held 100 percent accountable for any failures in the state government.

headline.main: With a Supermajority, California Democrats Begin to Make Plans
headline.print_headline: With a Supermajority, California Democrats Begin to Make Plans
